sourcesContent:
import React, { useRef, useEffect } from 'react' import { Power3, gsap } from 'gsap' import styles from './HeroSection.module.scss' const Hero = () => { let app = useRef(null) let images = useRef(null) let content = useRef(null) let tl = gsap.timeline({ delay: 0.01 }) useEffect(() => { //Images Vars const firstImg = images.firstElementChild const secondImg = images.lastElementChild console.log('FIRST: ') console.log(firstImg.firstElementChild) console.log('SECOND: ') console.log(secondImg.firstElementChild) //Content Vars const headlineFirst = content.children[0].children[0] const headlineSecond = content.children[0].children[1] const headlineThrid = content.children[0].children[2] const headlineFourth = content.children[0].children[3] const contentP = content.children[1] const contentButton = content.children[2] gsap.to(app, 0, { css: { visibility: 'visible' }, ease: Power3.easeOut, }) //Images Animations gsap.from(firstImg, { //y: 1000, ease: Power3.easeOut, background: '#e85a4f', duration: 1, height: 0, }) gsap.from(firstImg.children, { y: -1200, scale: 3, ease: Power3.easeOut, delay: 0.5, duration: 1, }) gsap.from(secondImg, { //y: 1280, ease: Power3.easeOut, background: '#e85a4f', duration: 1, height: 0, }) gsap.from(secondImg.children, { y: 1200, scale: 3, ease: Power3.easeOut, delay: 0.5, duration: 1, }) //Content Animations tl.staggerFrom( [headlineFirst, headlineSecond, headlineThrid, headlineFourth], 0.7, { y: 800, ease: 'Power3.easeOut', skewY: 40, }, 0.12, 'Start' ) .from( contentP, 1, { y: 20, opacity: 0, ease: 'back', }, 1.2 ) .from( contentButton, 1, { y: 20, opacity: 0, ease: 'back', }, 1.6 ) }) return (
(app = el)}>

(content = el)}>
Messie NUNGI-PAMBU
FRONTEND
DEVELOPER

(images = el)}>

Hi! I'm Messie, a{' '} Frontend Developer based in France.
Sensitive to design, i stress the smaller details to deliver pixel-perfect products.

I know how precious time is, especially in business, and how challenging it can be to retain the user attention, so i adapt quickly and listen carefully to your needs and i constantly try to always offer that little more than what make the difference.

#ReactJS #GatsbyJS #NextJS #Styled-Components
#JavaScript #Redux #Scss

) } export default Hero
